posts.post_content: I don't think he's quite first pick, but he's definitely up there. He just flat-out *stalls* like none other. Even if he doesn't kill his target, it can't be big enough to get through him on turn 4, and if he does, epic two-for-one. Probably third is when you're going to end up taking him, but feel free to take him earlier than that.
posts.html:
